item.title: Int problem
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

Just look at all of the other customs that are in that file, and basically see what they are using. Obviously, your format is differing from theirs. It also could be using class8 instead of itemDef

Read full topic

item.title: Int problem
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

[quote=“Kiryn, post:2, topic:537031”]yeah one of your cases is modelID

not modelid

Java variables are case sensitive[/quote]

To go off of that: itemActions, itemActions[1], itemActions[4] should be actions, actions[1], and actions[4]… as well as the modelRotationY should be modelRotation1, and modelRotationX should be modelRotation2, or the other way around.

Read full topic

item.title: Int problem
item.dc:creator: @Kiryn Kiryn
item.description:
@Kiryn wrote:

yeah one of your cases is modelID

not modelid

Java variables are case sensitive

Read full topic

item.title: Int problem
item.dc:creator: @scar3d scar3d
item.description:
@scar3d wrote:

So i tryed adding this int to my pi server

	itemDef.name ="TokHaar-Kal";
	itemDef.value = 60000;
	itemDef.anInt165 = 62575;
	itemDef.anInt200 = 62582;
	itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
	itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
	itemDef.modelOffset1 = -4;
	itemDef.modelid = 62592;
	itemDef.stackable = false;
	itemDef.description = "A cape made of ancient, enchanted rocks.";
	itemDef.modelZoom = 2086;
	itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
	itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
	itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop";
	itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
	itemDef.modelRotationY = 533;
	itemDef.modelRotationX = 333;
	break;

and i got this error

ItemDef.java:528: error: cannot find symbol
itemDef.modelid = 62592;
^
symbol: variable modelid
location: variable itemDef of type ItemDef
ItemDef.java:532: error: cannot find symbol
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
^
symbol: variable itemActions
location: variable itemDef of type ItemDef
ItemDef.java:533: error: cannot find symbol
itemDef.itemActions[1] = “Wear”;
^
symbol: variable itemActions
location: variable itemDef of type ItemDef
ItemDef.java:534: error: cannot find symbol
itemDef.itemActions[4] = “Drop”;
^
symbol: variable itemActions
location: variable itemDef of type ItemDef
ItemDef.java:536: error: cannot find symbol
itemDef.modelRotationY = 533;
^
symbol: variable modelRotationY
location: variable itemDef of type ItemDef
ItemDef.java:537: error: cannot find symbol
itemDef.modelRotationX = 333;
^
symbol: variable modelRotationX
location: variable itemDef of type ItemDef
Note: client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
6 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

rest of my ints look like this…

      case 13346:
              itemDef.modelID = 62700;
              itemDef.name = "Virtus robe legs";
              itemDef.description = "Virtus robe legs";
              itemDef.modelZoom = 1740;
              itemDef.modelRotation1 = 498;
              itemDef.modelRotation2 = 2045;
              itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1;
              itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4;
              itemDef.anInt165 = 62742;
              itemDef.anInt200 = 62758;
              itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
              itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
              itemDef.actions = new String[5];
              itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear";
              itemDef.actions[2] = "Check-charges";
              itemDef.actions[4] = "Drop";
          break;

Is this int wrong or how do i convert it in someway? thanks.

Read full topic
